programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extrao secuestr a Polly Klaas de doce aos durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entr en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitacin y descubrieron, a travs del uso de fuentes de luz lser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Despus de una extensa investigacin de dos meses, el FBI arrest a Richard Allen Davis. La impresin de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Larry Horn nearly got away with the perfect crime: a multiple murder-for-hire plot that was meticulously planned and executed. Horn's former wife, their 8-year-old son, and a live-in nurse were all brutally murdered by an assassin. In the absence of any significant clues, police in Maryland contacted the FBI to assist in the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigacin del FBI a gran escala llev a la recuperacin de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia fsica fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenan de la misma arma. El FBI se gan la confianza de un informante, cuya informacin condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extrao secuestr a Polly Klaas de doce aos durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entr en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitacin y descubrieron, a travs del uso de fuentes de luz lser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Despus de una extensa investigacin de dos meses, el FBI arrest a Richard Allen Davis. La impresin de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He was a recluse who spread terror through the mail for 18 years. Two men died and more than a dozen were injured, but Ted Kaczynski wasn't known as the Unabomber until his brother tipped off the FBI. Kaczynski's Unabomber Manifesto, published in major newspapers, set off a flurry of activity for the FBI: writing analysis and comparisons, DNA gleaned from a single postage stamp and finally, Kaczynski's arrest at his tiny cabin.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A retired police officer is discovered in his bed, dead from a single gunshot wound to the head. His wife first says the motive was robbery. Then she tells police he committed suicide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A suspicious fire swept through an apartment killing two young women. The cause of the fire and the identity of the victims were unclear. But a closer look at the fire scene revealed something hidden in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sheila Bryan, who was convicted of killing her mother in a car fire, is granted a new trial. An expert fire witness's opinion on how the fire ignited differs from the prosecution's theory. If verified, it would clear Bryan of any culpability.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sheila Bryan, who was convicted of killing her mother in a car fire, is granted a new trial. An expert fire witness's opinion on how the fire ignited differs from the prosecution's theory. If verified, it would clear Bryan of any culpability.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Safe Room
programme.desc: After Ian accidentally witnesses a break-in in the house across the street and records the horrific murder of the homeowner, Lila becomes embroiled in a deadly struggle to protect her son.

programme.title: Deadly Dispatch
programme.desc: After her best friend IS tragically murdered in an apparent robbery gone wrong, Tiffany Jackson takes justice in her own hands to find his killer.

programme.title: Stalker
programme.desc: A well-known Hollywood actress is suddenly tormented by a stalker. Her sister and high school boyfriend try to figure out who is tormenting her.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Murder invades a peaceful gated community when sixteen-year-old Arrijana Hill is stabbed to death after school. Was it a botched robbery, or payback from a jealous rival in a teenage romance? As police dig deeper, they uncover a tangled web of teenage drama and deadly ambition.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Cherished by all, Ida and Jana Randolph were a mother and daughter duo dedicated to lending a helping hand. But when they are found brutally murdered inside their apartment, police must dig into their personal lives to figure out who could have betrayed these beloved members of their tight knit Bronx community.

programme.title: Under The Influence
programme.desc: A womans life is thrown into a dangerous tailspin after ending an affair with the dangerous lover she met in Alcoholics Anonymous (AA).

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: A brilliant teenager is discovered murdered in cold blood, along with her unborn child. A search for the killer sends investigators inside the world of adolescent drama, where they must unravel a web of lies to unmask the culprit.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When Air Force Sgt. Derrick Tolliver is gunned down in his home, he appears to be a victim of burglary. But the crime scene doesnt add up, and suspects remain free. The case goes cold for three years, until a shocking confession reveals that, Derrick Tollivers untimely death was a result of a calculated betrayal that no one could have ever predicted.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Oakland, California mother Althea Housley struggles to put food on the table. So when her soul mate reveals a plan to make their dreams come true, she cant deny him. And in Gary, Indiana Jeri Woods demonstrates to her ten children just how viciously loyal they must be to her domineering husband.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Chicwanda Forbes has worked hard to make a life for herself in New Orleans, until an older man offers her the attention she craves in exchange for her loyalty. And in Fort Worth, career-driven Carter Carol Cervantez begins to rethink her priorities when she finds love at the workplace.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Quinn and Velazquez are called when Jerry Heard is found dead from gunshot wounds. They learn Heard spends his nights at a local bar, and the night he was killed, he made passes at two different women, one with an armed boyfriend. With at least three potential suspects, the detectives get to work.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Neighborhood character Willie Bell is found naked and dead early in the morning. With nothing else to go on, Quinn and Velazquez discover that Willie was seen with two different women the night before he was found. With two prime suspects, they try to find the truth.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: William Walker was an everyday hero, working hard as a firefighter to improve his community. But on the threshold of achieving his goals hes gunned down outside his Cleveland, Ohio home. To find the killer, detectives will have to cut through a web of deception, but little will prepare them for the truth.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: When a beloved high school football player dies while shielding three girls from bullets in a random shooting, a city comes together to seek justice for a young life lost.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In 1989 in New York, a vicious assault on a female jogger sparks a racially driven witch-hunt for her attackers, and police employ aggressive tactics to coerce confessions from five young men whose lives will change forever.

programme.title: Find Our Missing
programme.desc: A nursing student disappears in South Carolina after a receiving a mysterious text message. A 7 year-old girl never makes it to school in Milwaukee. They are two of the countless unsolved missing persons cases in the U.S. Help find our missing.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a man is shot in front of his children, his cousin seeks payback, sparking a months-long feud between two families and a back in forth battle of murder and arson wreaks havoc on the city of Toledo.

programme.desc: When a man is shot and killed soon after an alleged domestic assault, authorities suspect the girlfriend, but through their investigation they learn she did indeed seek payback, but it was not intended to be deadly.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes people about real news stories with unreal outcomes for a chance to win money. In "Surprising Sights," contestants learn about a strange seal rescue, a bizarre landmark and a wild wedding prank.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: These criminals may not have blood on their hands, but they still leave despair in their wake. From shady non-profits to fraudulent contractors, to wide-spread postal theft, here are some of the most devastating white-collar crimes to be attempted across the country.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Ashley meets an Oklahoma DIY-woodworker and a New Orleans spooky miniaturist.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Three jewelry makers in Greenville are about to take on some heavy metal as they go head-to-head to design and build an arm cuff inspired by the Liberty Bridge. Will their designs be too arm-twisting for the judges?

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion arent slowing down; theyre rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Whether its gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a stores ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: To Grandma's House we go! Chefs Mike Boggs and Nancy Longo face off, cooking up their favorite family recipes, but can they remember how Grandma used to make it?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Meet Nate, a 31-year-old pharmacist, as he embarks on a journey to find his special someone. With three remarkable women vying for a second date, who will emerge victorious and win Nate's heart?

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Join us as we skip the line of Greenville's most sought after weekend eateries for brunch. We'll head to Southern Culture and enjoy music with our grits, check out the Bohemian's DIY Bloody Mary Bar, and round out the day with Biscuit Head and Hen Dough.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Get in and get out of your comfort zone in the mountains of western Massachusetts. From boozy margaritas and snug motels to exhilarating ziplines and thrilling coasters. This is the Berkshires.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From an officer whose historic service is finally recognized, to a literary pioneer discovered right next door, every place has a hidden history. These are the unsung heroes, uncovered places, and untold connections in communities across this country.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristys a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Butter, burgers, bacon eggplant? There are many definitions of comfort food, but only one winner when Chef Keith Swiryn takes on Chef Garett Rodriguez in this classic dining challenge.

programme.title: WXII 12 Presents: The Year of The Trail
programme.desc: (2023) From the coastal shores to the mountain peaks, WXII 12's Lanie Pope explores the magnificent trails that North Carolina has to offer.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After eight members of one family were killed in their homes in a single night, residents of the devastated Ohio community were left to wonder if they were next.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: A Rich Young Killer
programme.desc: Joran Van Der Sloot, the primary suspect in the unsolved murder of American woman Natalee Holloway, is convicted of murdering a Peruvian woman. Plus, an angry soccer player fatally assaults a referee over a penalty call.

programme.title: An American Spy
programme.desc: FBI agent Robert Hanssen's treachery has been called the worst breach of U.S. intelligence in the history of the FBI. Plus, WorldCom executives fix the company's accounting numbers for their own personal gain.

programme.title: The Notorious Lobbyist
programme.desc: Jack Abramoff is one of the most successful US Lobbyists in history. However, his tactics aren't quite legal. Plus, the chairman of Daewoo is charged with masterminding accounting fraud worth 41 trillion dollars.

programme.title: A Rogue Trader
programme.desc: A rogue broker whose unauthorized speculative trading causes the spectacular collapse of Barings Bank. Plus, seven-time Tour de France winner Lance Armstrong is accused of doping and stripped of everything, including his once unconditional admiration.
